result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric L. SCHMIDT was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Intent. Contribute/Delinquency Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.40(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
($443.00 of the total amount is costs from 14 CF 120 which were ordered to be paid as a condition of probation in this case.   $163.00 court costs; $67.00 VW surcharge, $13.00 CLDA and $200.00 DNA surcharge)
Maintain fulltime employment, schooling or a combination of both.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Provide DNA sample and pay the surcharge.

No contact with A.M.S., DOB: 04-18-2010, unless approved the Department of Human Services.

No association with any known drug dealers or users.

timeConds.notes: Under the Huber Law, to commence immediately upon completion of the jail condition time in 13 CF 365.

records.addlTxt:
This case is riding along with 14 CF 120 which is set for a plea date on 05-06-14 at 8:30 a.m.
Minutes.

Settlement Conference Summary.
Plea hearing is set for 04-08-14 at 9:00 a.m.
State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.

Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed.  Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty pleas entered.  Jury calendar.
Settlement conference with District Attorney is set for 03-18-14 at 10:00 a.m.
Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.
Minutes.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing and waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held.  Preliminary hearing is set for 02-19-14 at 1:30 p.m.  
Minutes.

Order Modifying Bail Conditions.  
It is hereby ordered that the condition of bail requiring that the defendant have no contact with A.M.S. (DOB: 04-18-10) be modified as follows:
The defendant shall have no contact with A.M.S. (DOB: 04-18-10) unless authorized by the Manitowoc County Department of Human Services.  The defendant shall follow any guideline or rule of supervision set forth by the Manitowoc County Department of Human Services when having contact with A.M.S. (DOB: 04-18-10).  
Cover Letter.
Defense counsel did not show up.  Initial appearance reset to 02-03-14 at 2:30 p.m.
Brian Van Ells, through public defender.

Defendant requests counsel and is referred to the public defender.  Initial appearance is reset to 01-27-14 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $2,000.00 recognizance bond with the condition that defendant must report to the Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 24 hours and defendant is to have no contact with A.M.S., DOB: 04-18-2010.  Bail furnished.
Certificate of service of criminal summons and complaint with copy of same attached.

RE:  Bail jumping, on 10-28-13.
Initial appearance is set for 01-13-14 at 2:30 p.m.
